Speaking

Topic:

It has been said, â€œNot everything that is learned is contained in books.â€ Compare and contrast knowledge gained from experience with knowledge gained from books. In your opinion, which source is more important? Why?

Passage:

We gain our knowledge about the world and our life from two sources: from experience and fromã€€books. These two resources are both important, but which of them is more important?

Knowledge from books forms a very important part of our knowledge structure. In schools andã€€colleges, we learn knowledge which is fundamental to our future career. We learn knowledgeã€€from books in order to make our contributions to this society in the future. A student learnsã€€mathematic equations and other scientific knowledge and become a scientist or engineer. We willã€€be illiterate and ignorant without learning knowledge from books. Moreover, we acquireã€€knowledge about life and the world by reading books, magazines and newspapers. This is alsoã€€very important as we cannot experience everything all by ourselves. Therefore books are a veryã€€important source of knowledge.

On the other hand, we canâ€™t learn everything from a book. â€œExperience is the best teacherâ€ is anã€€old clichÃ©, but I agree with it. The most important, and sometimes the hardest, lessons we learn inã€€life come from our participation in situations. We learn how to get along with others or how toã€€have self-respect from our experience, not from books. We cannot learn emotional feelings, suchã€€as love and care, through books; they come from our real life experience. Knowledge fromã€€experience is also a very important supplement to knowledge from books.

Needless to say both learning sources, books and experience, are very important to us. But in myã€€opinion knowledge from experience is more important, because without knowledge fromã€€experience, it is impossible to get a real understanding of knowledge from books, and how toã€€apply this knowledge to real world situations.

Speaking

Topic:

Nowadays, food has become easier to prepare. Has this change improved the way people live? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.

Passage:

Man, through the ages, has undergone many changes, from a period when he hunted for his foodã€€to the present era when man is dependent on preprocessed foods. During this period not only hasã€€man changed his mode of eating but his whole lifestyle as well. In pursuit of more in thisã€€competitive world, man no longer has time as he once had. He is caught in a race against theã€€clock. A person who finishes more in lesser time is considered more efficient. This pressure to doã€€more in less time has affected his eating habits as well and, as a result, man no longer has time toã€€cook food. Early manâ€™s only objective was to seek food to sustain him and his family. Nowadaysã€€finding food has taken a back seat to other priorities, such as career and education.

Food is no longer of that importance. This is not an encouraging trend. People are too dependentã€€on preprocessed or precooked food, which no longer has the freshness it once had. Such foodsã€€loose their mineral and vitamin content and are not as healthy as fresh food. That is why theã€€number of diseases is also rising. People have also shifted to high calorie content food like Frenchã€€fries, pizzas, and ice cream, etc., which is causing obesity, fatigue, etc. As man is becoming busyã€€and too involved in his busy schedule, he has no time even to take care of his own personal needs.

Furthermore, cooking is an art which is dying out. People once enjoyed cooking . It was a meansã€€of eliminating stress and tension. People were once able to relax during this time and reflect onã€€their lives.

People may tend to argue that by using precooked and preprocessed food they are efficientlyã€€using time and can use this precious time saved for other purposes. But is it really worth it? This isã€€a question whose answer can invite much speculation about whether by saving this little time weã€€are inviting lots of other problems, which could easily be avoided. It is actually making our livesã€€not simpler but more complicated. We have lost many of the simpler things in our lives, like theã€€simple acts of selecting our evening meal, preparing it, and enjoying it with our loved ones, andã€€we are worse off for it.

entry.title: Hello Hexo
entry.content:
Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub.

Quick Start

More info: Writing

Deploy to remote sites

More info: Deployment
